decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed Location Plan, PY4623-015-005, PY4056/005
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - No development shall take place until the existing phone box shown on drawing titled SITE PLAN dated 18/06/24 on Pavement outside 151 Balham Hill SW12 9DL is removed in its entirety and the land made good to the same condition as the adjacent land.
Reason: To prevent the retention of redundant telecoms equipment in order to achieve an acceptable effect on the appearance, amenity and public safety of the location in accordance with Council Policies LP1, LP22 and LP50 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 4 - In the event that the communications hub scheme ceases or alters in a manner so as to leave this structure without function, then the structure shall be removed in its entirety and the land made good to the same condition as the adjacent land within 3 months of the cessation of the use of the structure.
Reason: To prevent the retention of redundant telecoms equipment in order to ensure no long term harm to the appearance, amenity and public safety of the location in accordance with Council Policy LP1 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: The footway and carriageway, on Balham Hill must not be blocked during the development. Temporary obstructions during the development must be kept to a minimum and should not encroach on the clear space needed to provide safe passage for pedestrians or obstruct the flow of traffic on Balham Hill. All vehicles associated with the development must only park/stop at permitted locations and within the time periods permitted by existing on-street restrictions.
Reason: To prevent obstructions and ensure the safe passage of  pedestrians and vehicles along Balham Hill so as to not cause impacts to the amenity and public safety of the location in accordance with Council Policy LP1 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023).

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023) as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
site_name: Telephone Box On Pavement West Of 151
description: Removal of existing telephone box and installation of 1x communications Kiosk with integrated advertising display.
subdivision_of_building: Removal of existing telephone box followed by the installation of a new communication kiosk on the same site
